question: Is omaveloxolone a suppressor of Nrf2?
ideal_answer: No, omaveloxolone is an activator of Nrf2.

snippets.text: The Effects of Two Nrf2 Activators, Bardoxolone Methyl and Omaveloxolone, on Retinal Ganglion Cell Survival during Ischemic Optic Neuropathy.
Omaveloxolone (RTA 408) is an activator of Nrf2 and an inhibitor of NFκB, possessing antioxidative and anti-inflammatory activities in mitochondrial bioenergetics.
